bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Josiah Quincy, August 14, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: No. 27. Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 14, 1893.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ending June 30, 1893.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, August 14, 1893.
Honorable Josiah Quincy, Assistant Sec'y of State, Washington, D. C.
Sir: I have the honor to transmit herewith the accounts and returns of the Consular Agent at Elmina, for the quarter ending June 30, 1893 as per inclosures.
I have the honor to be, sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U. S. Vice Consul
nclosures. Arrivals and departures of American Vessels Summary of business. Detailed Report of official services rendered & 5 Statement of services to American vessels
